paper_abstract: In this paper, we formulate and investigate the following problem: given integers d, k and r where k > r >= 1, d >= 2, and a prime power q, arrange d hyperplanes on F(q)(k) to maximize the number of r-dimensional subspaces of F(q)(k) each of which belongs to at least one of the hyperplanes. The problem is motivated by the need to give tighter bounds for an error-tolerant pooling design based on finite vector spaces.
paper_title: On a hyperplane arrangement problem and tighter analysis of an error-tolerant pooling design
